name: dedth2h
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4
body: -| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(w2, w3))
-| wi(wceq(c2, cif(c2, c3, w1)), wb(w3, w4))

stmt.origin: dedth(c0, c1, w0, wi(w1, w2), wi(w1, w3))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(wi(w1, w2), wi(w1, w3)))
-| wi(w1, w3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), w2)
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(wi(w1, w2), wi(w1, w3)))
-| wi(w1, w3)

stmt.origin: imbi2d(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), w1, w2, w3)
stmt.pretty: imbi2d(c0 = if(w0, c0, c1), w1, w2, w3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(wi(w1, w2), wi(w1, w3)))
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(w2, w3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), w2)
-| wi(w1, w3)
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(w2, w3))

body.origin:
|- wi(w1, w3)
-| wi(wceq(c2, cif(c2, c3, w1)), wb(w3, w4))
-| w4

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), w2)
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w0)), wb(w2, w3))
-| wi(wceq(c2, cif(c2, c3, w1)), wb(w3, w4))
-| w4

comment: Weak deduction theorem eliminating two hypotheses. This theorem is simpler to use than ~ dedth2v but requires that each hypothesis have exactly one class variable. See also comments in ~ dedth . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-1999.)
